Articles.Content: This is my rover I built for collecting science from around the complex. It works great, except that pressing A makes it go right, and D makes it go left. What might be causing this? I've tried removing and re-placing the wheel scaffolding on opposite sides, but it's the same.
You can right click the wheels and reverse the steering I believe

I almost allways end up having to do that.

Also, if you install KSPwheel api mod you have more tweaks you can make (also enable advanced tweakables in the settings menu of the game, and install kerbal foundries wheels mod...
Are you sure you have a control point (probe core/pod/docking port) facing front of the rover? Did you try to press A when your navball looks pure cyan?
The control part of this craft is pointing straight up. It thinks it is lying on its back, so you are not yawing left or right but rather rolling left and right.
Ah, I figured it was something like that! That makes sense.
